Collection.name: Records
Collection.type: Eamon.ThirdParty.BTree`1[[Eamon.Framework.IHint, Eamon, Version=1.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]], Eamon, Version=1.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: EAMON CS 1.3 GENERAL HELP.

1. Commands may be abbreviated on the left or right side. Examples: "A Dr" or "A Gon" for "Attack Dragon", "Req Ray From Al" or "Req Gun From Ien" for "Request Ray Gun From Alien", "Put Pum In Lar" or "Put Pie In Oven" for "Put Pumpkin Pie In **107

2. Sometimes items may be in a room but won't show up until you Examine them. Pay close attention to all descriptions. Note: Look only repeats the room description and -nothing- else. Use Examine to, well, examine things.

3. Before you can manipulate items that are inside of other items, you must Remove them from that item. There is no "Remove All" command, but if you Attack a (breakable) container, all of its contents will be emptied to the floor and you can "Get All".

4. Type Save and a number for a desired save position to Quick Save (save without having to verify). Adding a description will rename that slot. Examples: "Save 2" or "Save 5 Dark Room (No Grues)". Also works with Restore. (Type "Restore 1", etc.)

5. You can Inventory companions (normally anyone whom, when you Smile, smiles back at you) to see what they are carrying and wearing. You can then Request those items from them. You can also Inventory containers to get a list of contents.
6. If you give food or a beverage to a friend, they will take a bite or drink and give it back to you.

7. To give money to someone, type Give and an amount. For example, "Give 1000 To IRS Agent" would pay 1000 gold coins to the nice IRS Agent. In most standard adventures, if you "Give 5000" or more, a neutral monster will -usually- become your friend.
8. The Power spell has been known to have strange and marvelous effects in many adventures. When all else fails (or just for fun) try "Power".

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: EAMON CS 1.3 NEW COMMANDS.
1. The Go command allows you to travel through any door/gate you encounter, including those that are free-standing (not associated with a room directional link).

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: How do I proceed to the eponymous laboratory?
1. The tiled, silver-walled room near the shore has a secret.
2. Examine either the wall or the engraving to reveal that the wall appears to be fake-looking.

3. You may Attack the fake-looking back wall to proceed into the laboratory. (Beware of the booby trap, however. If the electrified floor kills you before you're able to chip away the wall, "Attack Floor.")

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: How do I pass through the oval door?
1. There are two ways to proceed past this door: a safe way, and a dangerous way.
2. For the dangerous way, you may Attack the glass walls to pass through. You will, however, set off an alarm and numerous enemies will swarm in to stop you.

3. For the safe way, Search the body of the third worker android you encounter to acquire the plastic card. You must first sterilize yourself by Using the green button in the room with the oval door; then you may Use the plastic card to pass.

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: How do I gain information for the mayor?
1. Aside from exploring every room in the laboratory, there are three things the Reading of which will yield information.
2. The first is the plaque in the reception area.
3. The second is the computer terminal in the scientific center (past the oval door). It doesn't at all times yield fruitful information; keep Reading it until you get the information.

4. The third is the display screen in the seismic station. If you read all three of those items and explore every room in the underwater lab, you will have completed 100% of the quest and be paid the full reward.
5. (You can also use the Score command at any time to see how much of your quest has been completed.)

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: What does hitting this button or turning this dial do?
1. Like many adventures, there are a lot of things to do only for fun.

2. The buttons in the kitchen area will produce experimental food for your use; once it's been eaten, you may return for more and the green button in the room with the oval door will sterilize your party for entry into the science center.
3. Aside from that, the rest of the buttons and dials are there for your amusement. Note that some buttons and dials will only appear after you Examine control panels or similar artifacts.

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: How do I get the Aquatron Seven up and running?
1. The Aquatron Seven is currently a non-functional piece of scenery. But it is also an obvious extension point, so don't be surprised if the game is enhanced in the future to support this.
2. Alternately, you could always sit down with the Eamon CS Adventure Design tools and add this functionality yourself.

Collection.name: FreeUids
